qas.question: In what region does Estonia hold one of the highest per capita income levels?
Being close to what commercial area gives Estonia a competitive advantage?
What is a major trait of the Estonian employed workers?
What is the largest city in Estonia?

context: Estonia has had a market economy since the end of the 1990s and one of the highest per capita income levels in <a0_0>Eastern<a0_0/> Europe. Proximity to the <a1_0>Scandinavian markets<a1_0/>, its location between the East and West, competitive cost structure and a <a2_0>highly skilled<a2_0/> labour force have been the major Estonian comparative advantages in the beginning of the 2000s (decade). As the largest city, <a3_0>Tallinn<a3_0/> has emerged as a financial centre and the Tallinn Stock Exchange joined recently with the OMX system. The current government has pursued tight fiscal policies, resulting in balanced budgets and low public debt.
